New Records: Travis Head scored a career-best 154 not out to underpin Australia's chase of 316 to win the first one-day international against England and gain a 13th straight victory in the 50-over format
Key Match Events: Ben Duckett hit 95 in England's 315 all out at Trent Bridge
Australia's spinners, including part-time slow bowler Marnus Labuschagne, slowed down the run rate and took nine wickets in total
Travis Head hit 20 fours and five sixes as Australia strolled to 317-3 and a seven-wicket victory with six overs remaining
Pre-Game Insights: England stand-in captain Harry Brook said they were eyeing up a big score, but it wasn't meant to be
Australia captain Mitchell Marsh said the longer the innings went on, they thought pace off was the better option
Post-Match Reflections: Travis Head said he's worked extremely hard over a few years and plays the game a bit more relaxed now
Head said he takes it for what it is and tries to enjoy what he's doing, and it's coming off in the way he's playing
Miscellaneous Highlights: The second ODI of the five-match series between the fierce cricket rivals is at Headingley on Saturday
Australia will hope to have senior players Mitchell Starc, Josh Hazlewood and Glenn Maxwell available, after they missed out in Nottingham because of illness
